title: Cleta Mitchell
deleted: On January 2, 2021 Cleta Mitchell participated with Donald Trump in a phone call with the Secretary of State of Georgia Brad Raffensperger to try to intimidate him into treasonously changing the results of the 2020 Presidental Election.  She helped Donald Trump to berate Raffensperger, and threaten him.  She is now being investigated for disbarment due to her felonious actions.   https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia-vote/2021/01/03/d45acb92-4dc4-11eb-bda4-615aaefd0555_story.html

title: Cleta Mitchell
added: Mitchell was a leading critic of the IRS for [[IRS targeting controversy|allegedly targeting tea party groups]].<ref name=":4">{{Cite news|last=|first=|date=2017|title=Fallout from allegations of tea party targeting hamper IRS oversight of nonprofits|work=The Washington Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/investigations/fallout-from-allegations-of-tea-party-targeting-hamper-irs-oversight-of-nonprofits/2017/12/17/6403c1c0-c59e-11e7-a441-3a768c8586f1_story.html|url-status=live|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=":5">{{Cite web|last=Schwartz|first=Brian|date=2019-06-25|title=Steve Bannon hires D.C. super lawyer and Mueller skeptic to represent his nonprofit|url=https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/25/bannon-hires-mueller-skeptic-cleta-mitchell-to-represent-his-nonprofit.html|access-date=2021-01-03|website=CNBC|language=en}}</ref> She testified before Congress in 2014, saying "There are lies upon lies in this ugly episode... The commissioner of the IRS lied to congress."<ref name=":5" /> She called for the abolishment of the IRS.<ref name=":4" /> Investigations by Congress and federal agencies later concluded that there was no evidence that the IRS specifically targeted conservative groups.<ref name=":4" />

Mitchell was the trustee of EPA administrator [[Scott Pruitt]]'s legal defense fund. As trustee of that fund, she sought donations to the fund by individuals who had interests before the EPA.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Bogardus|first=Kevin|last2=E|last3=Wednesday|first3=E. News reporterPublished:|last4=April 24|last5=2019|title=EPA: Pruitt's lawyer sought billionaire's help for fund|url=https://www.eenews.net/stories/1060211709|access-date=2021-01-03|website=www.eenews.net|language=en}}</ref> In 2019, she represented Stephen Bannon's nonprofit.<ref name=":5" />

title: Cleta Mitchell
added: As a student she was a proponent of the women's rights movement and campaigned for the passage of the [[Equal Rights Amendment]]. She considered US Senator [[Margaret Chase Smith]] of Maine her role model.<ref name=oral/>

title: Cleta Mitchell
added: Mitchell was a part of the January 2nd, 2021 phone call from President Trump to Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger where Trump pressured the Secretary to "find" over 11,000 votes in order to overturn the results of the 2020 election, based on doctored videos and unsubstantiated rumors from right wing media. A recording of the call was leaked to the Washington Post and news broke of the pressure campaign by Trump to invalidate Georgia's election results.
